application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
site_name: North Of Network Rail Cutting And East Of Mandeville Road Worksite
decision_conditions: The proposed changes in relation to the headhouse, earthworks, fencing, soft landscaping and lighting, approved under planning application ref: 230131HS2 dated 06/03/2023 are considered to be non-material changes in accordance with Section 21, Schedule 17 of the High Speed Rail (London-West Midlands) Act 2017.
1. The details hereby approved shall be implemented in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents:

1MC04-SCJ_SDH-AR-DGA-SS05_SL06-380012 rev C02 (General Arrangement Plan); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-AR-DPH-SS05_SL06-380091 rev C02 (Material Board); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-AR-DEL-SS05_SL06-383031 rev C02 (Headhouse Elevations); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-AR-DSE-SS05_SL06-382021 rev C02 (Headhouse Section AB); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-LS-DGA-SS05_SL06-381003 rev C02 (Landscape General Arrangement Plan Hard Landscape and Earthworks Sheet 1 of 2); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-LS-DGA-SS05_SL06-381004 rev C02 (Landscape General Arrangement Plan Hard Landscape and Earthworks Sheet 2 of 2); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-LS-DSE-SS05_SL06-382011 rev C02 (Earthworks Cross Sections Sheet 1 of 2); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-LS-DSE-SS05_SL06-382012 rev C02 (Earthworks Cross Sections Sheet 2 of 2); 1MC04-SCJ_SDH-EL-DDE-SS05_SL06-384451 rev C02 (External Lighting and Installation Details)
Reason: In order to ensure that the permission granted is defined in accordance with Schedule 17 of the High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Act 2017
description: Application for a Non-Material Change (Section 21, Schedule 17 of the High Speed Rail (London-West Midlands) Act 2017) Â seeking to allow changes to the headhouse building, fencing, earthworks and lighting in relation to approval reference 230131HS2 dated 06/03/2023 for Development authorised by the High Speed Rail (London-West Midlands) Act 2017 relating to; a vent shaft headhouse building with a footprint of 58m x 29m, comprising three principle connected headhouse elements (mechanical and electrical plant building, fan room and ventilation stacks) and access stairs located adjacent to the building. Road vehicle parking within the compound with a hardstanding area of approximately 820m2. Earthworks within the compound area for the headhouse building and associated hardstanding area, regrading and extension of existing access road, gabion walls for ecological enhancement with a slight retaining function, a flood defence wall with a slight retaining function, a retaining wall on the northeast site boundary, and retaining walls adjacent to the access stairs on the embankment. Security fencing encircling the headhouse building, boundary fencing along the private access road and area of ecological mitigation, vehicle barrier adjacent to the south side of the access road, and guard rails adjacent to the access stairs. Artificial lighting equipment at the compound entrance, affixed to the headhouse building and walls, and pole mounted within the compound
